A measure for quantifying noise in single-cell Hi-C data.

name: GiniQC

metadata.abstract: © 2020 The Author(s). Published by Oxford University Press. All rights reserved.Single-cell Hi-C (scHi-C) allows the study of cell-to-cell variability in chromatin structure and dynamics. However, the high level of noise inherent in current scHi-C protocols necessitates careful assessment of data quality before biological conclusions can be drawn. Here, we present GiniQC, which quantifies unevenness in the distribution of inter-chromosomal reads in the scHi-C contact matrix to measure the level of noise. Our examples show the utility of GiniQC in assessing the quality of scHi-C data as a complement to existing quality control measures. We also demonstrate how GiniQC can help inform the impact of various data processing steps on data quality.
metadata.title: GiniQC: A measure for quantifying noise in single-cell Hi-C data
